alert.note: Alert for Liberty (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:19PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will impact portions of central Liberty County through 245 PM MDT... At 217 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm 13 miles north of Chester, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, brief heavy rain, and occasional lightning strikes. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Liberty County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. The heavy rainfall may lead to localized minor flooding of roads, small creeks, and low-lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Occasional cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
